author: Aria Bendix
title: Even mild coronavirus cases can be brutal. Here's how to know when you should go to the hospital.
description: Severe coronavirus cases tend to get worse about five to 10 days after symptoms start. Signs that you should go to the hospital include difficulty walking across a room or up a flight of stairs. Patients who struggle to speak in full sentences should be seen …
content:
For many coronavirus patients, the symptoms start out mild. On the first day or two, a typical patient might experience a fever, dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle soreness, or fatigue.
If symptoms worsen, they typically do so within five to 10 days.
